summary: Decentralized ecosystems are more resilient and vibrant than centralized ones by empowering communities to control resources and decisions. Regenerative design, including permaculture and biomimicry, aims to improve the environment sustainably. Regenerative practices focus on collaboration within ecosystems, promoting balance and health over time.
excerpt: Regenerative design uses techniques like permaculture and biomimicry to create sustainable and collaborative ecosystems, enhancing their resilience and health without centralized control.
